ARABIC: لِيَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ ءَاتَيْنَٰهُمْ فَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: ungrateful for what We have given them. Enjoy yourselves. You will soon know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So as to deny what We have bestowed on them. Well, enjoy yourselves, you will come to know soon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: that they may show ingratitude for the bounties We bestowed upon them. So enjoy yourselves for a while, soon you will come to know (the truth).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In the end you will reject Our bounties. Enjoy yourselves; you will soon know (the consequences of your deeds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In order to deny the favours We have given them; so enjoy a little; for you will soon come to know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So they are ungrateful for that which We have given them! Then enjoy yourselves but you will soon come to know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So that they be ungrateful for what We have given them; then enjoy yourselves; for soon will you know
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: that they may show unthankfulness for that We have given them. So take your joy; certainly you will soon know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So as to deny that which We have given them. Then enjoy life (while ye may), for ye will come to know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: showing no gratitude for what We have given them. Enjoy yourselves awhile; but soon you will know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: That they may show ingratitude for that which We have vouchsafed unto them. Enjoy then, presently ye shall know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: being unthankful for what We have given them. So let them enjoy. Soon they shall know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (As if) to show their ingratitude for the favours we have bestowed on them! then enjoy (your brief day): but soon will ye know (your folly)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So (as a result of that) they deny (with ungratefulness) that (Allah's Favours) which We have bestowed on them! Then enjoy yourselves (your short stay), but you will come to know (with regrets).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: that they may show ingratitude for what We gave them. So, take your pleasure, you shall soon know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: To show ingratitude for what We have given them. Enjoy yourselves. You will soon know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So they will deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [16:55] in order to deny that, grace, which We have given them. So enjoy, that consent of yours to worship idols (an imperative meant as a threat): for soon you shall know, the consequence of this.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So as to deny that which We have given them) of bounty and thus say it was given to us through the intercession of our gods. (Then enjoy life (while you may)) live in disbelief and the forbidden, (for ye will come to know) what will be done to you.
